sections.title: Interpretation
sections.summary: Defines key terms used throughout the Act including 'child', 'parent', 'family violence', 'de facto relationship'

sections.title: Objects of Part VII and principles underlying it
sections.summary: Sets out that the objects are to ensure children have meaningful relationships with both parents and are protected from harm

sections.title: Child's best interests paramount consideration
sections.summary: In deciding whether to make a particular parenting order, a court must regard the best interests of the child as the paramount consideration

sections.title: How a court determines what is in a child's best interests
sections.summary: Lists primary considerations (safety, meaningful relationship) and additional considerations (views of child, nature of relationship, capacity of parents)

required_elements.description: Benefit of meaningful relationship with both parents

sections.title: Equal shared parental responsibility
sections.summary: When making a parenting order, the court must apply a presumption that it is in the best interests of the child for parents to have equal shared parental responsibility

sections.title: Court to consider spending equal time or substantial and significant time with each parent
sections.summary: If presumption of equal shared parental responsibility applies, court must consider whether equal time or substantial and significant time is reasonably practicable and in child's best interests

sections.title: Informing court about family violence
sections.summary: Parties must inform the court of any family violence or child abuse allegations

sections.title: Principles for conducting child-related proceedings
sections.summary: Sets out principles including that proceedings should be conducted in a way that safeguards children and promotes cooperative parenting

sections.title: Definition of family violence
sections.summary: Defines family violence as violent, threatening or other behaviour that coerces or controls a family member or causes fear

sections.title: Definition of abuse in relation to a child
sections.summary: Defines abuse to include assault, sexual abuse, serious psychological harm, and serious neglect

sections.title: Alteration of property interests
sections.summary: Court may make orders altering the interests of parties in property - the foundation of property settlement

sections.title: Property - matters to be taken into account
sections.summary: Court must consider (a) financial contributions, (b) non-financial contributions, (c) contributions as homemaker or parent, (d) future needs factors

required_elements.description: Direct financial contributions to acquisition/maintenance of property
Contributions to welfare of family as homemaker or parent

sections.title: Matters to be taken into account - future needs
sections.summary: Factors including age, health, income, earning capacity, care of children under 18, standard of living, needs of children

sections.title: Alteration of property interests - de facto relationships
sections.summary: Equivalent to s79 for de facto relationships - court may alter property interests

sections.title: Duty of court to end financial relations
sections.summary: Court must make orders that will finally determine the financial relationships between the parties and avoid further proceedings

sections.title: Application for decree of dissolution of marriage
sections.summary: Application for divorce may be made where parties separated for at least 12 months and there is no reasonable likelihood of cohabitation

sections.title: Irretrievable breakdown of marriage
sections.summary: The sole ground for divorce is irretrievable breakdown established by 12 months separation

sections.title: Child support - court orders
sections.summary: Court may make orders for child maintenance in certain circumstances

sections.title: Parenting orders - what they are
sections.summary: A parenting order may deal with the person(s) with whom a child is to live, spend time, communicate, parental responsibility allocation

sections.title: Effect of parenting order that provides for shared parental responsibility
sections.summary: Each parent must consult and make genuine effort to reach joint decision on major long-term issues

sections.title: Obligations created by parenting orders
sections.summary: Parenting orders create obligations that must be complied with

sections.title: Contravention of parenting orders
sections.summary: Consequences for contravening parenting orders without reasonable excuse

sections.title: Costs
sections.summary: Each party bears own costs unless court orders otherwise - costs follow the event is NOT the rule

sections.title: Child's right to spend time with other persons
sections.summary: Children have a right to spend time with grandparents and other significant persons on a regular basis

sections.title: Family dispute resolution
sections.summary: Parties must attempt family dispute resolution before filing parenting applications, subject to exceptions

sections.title: Exceptions to FDR requirement
sections.summary: FDR not required where family violence, child abuse, urgency, or other prescribed circumstances

sections.title: Court to have regard to parenting plans
sections.summary: Court must have regard to terms of most recent parenting plan between parties

sections.title: Evidence of family consultants
sections.summary: Court may order family consultant to provide a report or give evidence about matters relevant to the child

sections.title: Location and recovery orders
sections.summary: Court may make orders for location and return of a child

sections.title: Relocation
sections.summary: Considerations when a parent seeks to relocate with a child

related_legislation.name: Family Law Rules 2004
related_legislation.relevance: Procedural rules for Federal Circuit and Family Court

related_legislation.name: Child Support (Assessment) Act 1989
related_legislation.relevance: Assessment and calculation of child support

related_legislation.name: Federal Circuit and Family Court of Australia Act 2021
related_legislation.citation: Federal Circuit and Family Court of Australia Act 2021 (Cth)
related_legislation.relevance: Establishes the court structure for family law matters
